titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frick Fine Arts Library Subject Files, 1939-1989 FFAL.001
titlestmt.author: Rose Chiango.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:42:15 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Frick Fine Arts Library Subject Files
did.abstract: This collection consists of files on art subjects collected by library staff at the Frick Fine Arts Library. The majority of these items are from 1960-1979, though there are items from 1930-1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are listed alphabetically, roughly as they were found. The original structure of the files has been preserved.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Rose Chiango, completed August 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection includes newspaper clippings, bibliographies, postcards, pamphlets, guidebooks, exhibition catalogs, and photographs. Notable items are indicated when appropriate.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frick Fine Arts Library Subject Files, 1939-1989, FFAL.001, Frick Fine Arts Library, University of Pittsburgh

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Information Files of Frick Fine Arts Library were maintained from the library's inception in 1965 to approximately 1985. Some material dates prior to 1965, and the bulk of the material is from the 1960s and 1970s. A wide range of materials is contained within the files, including newspaper clippings, brochures, pamphlets, maps, mailings, posters, and other paper ephemera.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Frick Fine Arts Library Artist Files, 1892-1990, FFAL.002, Frick Fine Arts Library, University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item Listing: "Helen Clay Frick dies at Point Breeze Estate", November 10, 1984, Pittsburgh Post Gazette. "Helen Clay Frick dies at 96", November 10, 1984, Pittsburgh Post Gazette. ""Frick & Pittsburgh", February 16, 1967, Pittsburgh Catholic. "Defender of a Memory: Helen Clay Frick", May 26, 1967, The New York Times. "History of Frick Upheld in Court", May 26, 1967, The New York Times, "Defamation: Victory for Historians", June 2, 1967, Time Magazine. "Lawyers Defends Frick Litigation", September 21, 1966, The Pitt News "Stevens' Lawyer Attacks Frick Editorial", November 2, 1966, The Pitt News. "Frick Author Discusses Trial", October 3, 1966, The Pitt News. "Miss Frick Loses Book Libel Suit" "Frick's Attorney Clarifies Stand", February 24, 1967, The Pitt News. "Miss Frick Loses Suit Over Book", May 26, 1967, Pittsburgh Press. "2-Year-Old Frick Case Up to Judge", January 12, 1967, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette. "Editorial: The Frick Scylla & Charybdis", October 5, 1966, The Pitt News. "Miss Frick's Lawyer Discusses Litigation; Attacks Stevens' Book", October 5, 1966, The Pitt News. "Frick's Daughter Sues Historian Over Appraisal", July 5, 1966, The New York Times. "Judge Upholds Book About Frick", May 26, 1967, Pittsburgh Post Gazette. "Profiles: Daughter of her Father - I", July 15, 1939, The New Yorker. "Profiles: Daughter of her Father - II", Jusy 22, 1939, The New Yorker. The Frick Collection [New York], Brochure. Photocopy of original plaque inscriptions for library. "Filial Piety and the First Amendment" by Oliver Jensen in American Heritage. Bibliography of Frick articles, 1920-1929. "Pitt Selects Frick Arts Director, Outlines Plans", Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.
